metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7939 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, when the Harmony proxy in Google V8 is enabled, allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via crafted JavaScript code with Proxy.create and console.log calls, related to HTTP responses that lack an "X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff" header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7939` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> Harmony features are disabled in Oxide and there is no mechanism to enable them

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068').
